de.esoco.ewt.layout

Class TableGridLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.layout.GenericLayout
      • de.esoco.ewt.layout.TableGridLayout

  • public class TableGridLayout
extends GenericLayout
    A table-based grid layout.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TableGridLayout()
      Creates a new GridLayout instance with a single row of components.
      TableGridLayout(int nColumns)
      Creates a new GridLayout instance with a certain number of columns.
      TableGridLayout(int nGridCount, boolean bIsColumnCount)
      Creates a new GridLayout instance with a certain number of columns or rows.
      TableGridLayout(int nGridCount, boolean bIsColumnCount, int nGap)
      Creates a new GridLayout instance with a certain number of columns or rows and gaps between the grid cells.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCellStyle(Container rContainer, java.lang.String sStyle)
      Adds a style name to the cell in which the last component has been added to this layout.

      Overridden to set the widget into the next grid cell according to the settings of this grid layout.

      Adds or removes a style name for the cell of a certain component.

      Removes all widgets from this layout's container.

      Creates a new GWT container widget that represents this layout.

      Sets the size of the cell in which the last component has been added to this layout.
      void setGridCount(int nCount)
      Sets the grid count, interpreted as columns or rows depending on the layout configuration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableGridLayout

        public TableGridLayout()
        Creates a new GridLayout instance with a single row of components.

      • TableGridLayout

        public TableGridLayout(int nColumns)
        Creates a new GridLayout instance with a certain number of columns. The number of rows will be calculated from the number of components in the container.
        Parameters:
        nColumns - The number of grid columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the count value is <= 0

      • TableGridLayout

        public TableGridLayout(int nGridCount,
                       boolean bIsColumnCount)
        Creates a new GridLayout instance with a certain number of columns or rows. The boolean parameter defines if the count value contains the number of columns (TRUE) or rows (FALSE). In each case the other number will be calculated from the number of components in the container.
        Parameters:
        nGridCount - The number of grid columns or rows
        bIsColumnCount - TRUE for a fixed column count or FALSE for a fixed row count
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the grid count value is <= 0

      • TableGridLayout

        public TableGridLayout(int nGridCount,
                       boolean bIsColumnCount,
                       int nGap)
        Creates a new GridLayout instance with a certain number of columns or rows and gaps between the grid cells. The boolean parameter defines if the nCount value contains the row or column count. In each case the other number will be calculated from the number of components in the container.
        Parameters:
        nGridCount - The number of grid columns or rows
        bIsColumnCount - TRUE for a fixed column count or FALSE for a fixed row count
        nGap - The gap between components
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the grid count value is <= 0

    • Method Detail

      • addCellStyle

        public void addCellStyle(Container rContainer,
                         java.lang.String sStyle)
        Adds a style name to the cell in which the last component has been added to this layout.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to set the cell style in
        sStyle - The style name to add

      • addWidget

        public void addWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets rContainer,
                      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget rWidget,
                      StyleData rStyleData,
                      int nIndex)
        Overridden to set the widget into the next grid cell according to the settings of this grid layout.
        Overrides:
        addWidget in class GenericLayout
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to add the widget to
        rWidget - The widget to add
        rStyleData - The style defining the layout position of the widget
        nIndex - The index to add the widget add (if supported by the implementation) or -1 to add as the last widget
        See Also:
        GenericLayout.addWidget(HasWidgets, Widget, StyleData, int)

      • changeCellStyle

        public void changeCellStyle(Container rContainer,
                            Component rComponent,
                            java.lang.String sStyle,
                            boolean bAdd)
        Adds or removes a style name for the cell of a certain component.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to modify the cell style in
        rComponent - The component
        sStyle - The style name to add or remove
        bAdd - TRUE to add the style, FALSE to remove

      • clear

        Description copied from class: GenericLayout
        Removes all widgets from this layout's container.
        Overrides:
        clear in class GenericLayout
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to clear
        See Also:
        GenericLayout.clear(HasWidgets)

      • createLayoutContainer

        public com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel createLayoutContainer(Container rContainer,
                                                                 StyleData rContainerStyle)
        Creates a new GWT container widget that represents this layout. This method is only intended to be used internally by the GEWT framework.
        Specified by:
        createLayoutContainer in class GenericLayout
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The GEWT container to create the widget for
        rContainerStyle - The style of the container widget
        Returns:
        A new widget container

      • getGridCount

        public int getGridCount()
        Returns the number of rows or columns of this layout.
        Returns:
        The column count

      • isColumnCount

        public boolean isColumnCount()
        Returns TRUE if the count number defines the layout columns.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the count is the number of columns, FALSE if it's the number of rows

      • joinColumns

        public void joinColumns(Container rContainer,
                        int nCount)
        Sets the number of columns that the last component added to this layout's container will span. This grid layout must belong to the given container or else the result will be undefined. This method must be invoked directly after the component that shall span the columns had been added.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to join the columns in
        nCount - The number of columns to join

      • joinRows

        public void joinRows(Container rContainer,
                     int nCount)
        Sets the number of rows that the last component added to this layout's container will span. This grid layout must belong to the given container or else the result will be undefined. This method must be invoked directly after the component that shall span the rows had been added.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to join the rows in
        nCount - The number of rows to join

      • setCellSize

        public void setCellSize(Container rContainer,
                        java.lang.String sWidth,
                        java.lang.String sHeight)
        Sets the size of the cell in which the last component has been added to this layout.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to set the component cell size of
        sWidth - The width of the component's cell or NULL for none
        sHeight - The height of the component's cell or NULL for none

      • setGridCount

        public final void setGridCount(int nCount)
        Sets the grid count, interpreted as columns or rows depending on the layout configuration.
        Parameters:
        nCount - The new grid count
